Claim: Gravity pulls objects down.
Data: Science suggets gravity is a universal constant
Warrant: We have general models of gravity that suggest it works all over the universe

Claim: Dogs are fluffy.
Data: I touched a dog that was fluffy.
Warrant: This dog is similar to other dogs.

Claim: Not everyone votes in American society.
Data: Some employers don't let voters leave during work.
Warrant: Barriers to voting reduce the number of voters in an election.

Claim: Democracy and voting are important American values.
Data: Historically, both have been very important to the history of the United States.
Warrant: Text books are a useful record of history.

Claim: Debate is fun.
Data: You get to know people.
Warrant: Meeting new people is fun.

Claim: Debate is fun.
Data: You get to compete with your peers.
Warrant: Competeting against opponents is exciting.

Claim: Debate is fun.
Data: You learn when you debate.
Warrant: Learning is a fun way to spend a weekend.

Claim: Global climate change is an important public issue.
Data: It will reduce global food production in future years.
Warrant: NASA has models that have been updating for 15 years.

Claim: Snakes are cold blooded.
Data: They must lay in the sun or they will die.
Warrant: Sun laying behavior is a sign of being cold blooded.

Claim: Waterbottles can be made from recycled plastics.
Data: There are many companies which make water bottles from recycled plastics.
Warrant: Companies are truthful when they report on how they make their produts.

Claim: Religions helps many people.
Data: Many religions encourage their practicers to help those in the communities that they live in. '
Warrant: Helping others helps those who help and those who recieve help.

Claim: Religions can hurt people.
Data: Religions often tell practicers what to think and act.
Warrant: Reducing free thought harms people

Claim: Ice cream tastes good
Data: There is chocolate icecream
Warrant: Chocolate anything tastes good.

Claim: Anything chocolate tastes good.
Data: Chocolate produces brain chemicals like dopamine.
Warrant: Dopamine makes us feel good.

Claim: Dairy is good for developing bodies.
Data: Dairy products are high in protein, health fats, calcium and vitamin D.
Warrant: Nutrients help bodies develope correctly.

Claim: Learning musical instruments helps people appreciate art.
Data: Learning a musical instrument involves learning about music.
Warrant: Learning about music increases knowledge of musical arts.

Claim: Having fun while learning increases your grades.
Data: People who have fun while learning remember information better than those who don't.
Warrant: People remember things that are fun and happy better than upsetting.

Claim: Having fun increases your memory.
Data: Studies show physically fit people retain information better.
Warrant: People should trust published research.

Claim: Being fit increases your memory.
Data: Studies show physically fit people retain information better.
Warrant: Information retention is the same thing as memory.

Claim: STEM skills are practical and employable.
Data: There is a large market for students with STEM skills.
Warrant: Big markets mean it will be easy for a worker to be hired.

Claim: Some STEM skills will be replaced by automization of labor in the future.
Data: Future machine learning and artificial intellegence will make artificial  intelligence that will be able to program.
Warrant: Programming is a STEM skill.

Claim: Snakes are great beginner pets.
Data: You don't have to play with them daily.
Warrant: Pets that don't need daily play are easy to take care of.

Claim: Teachers need students to have phones in classrooms for learning.
Data: Applications like CognitZen, Duolingo, and Khan Academy help students to learn in class.
Warrant: Some teachers use supplimental technology learning services.

Claim: Students will find ways to distract themselves.
Data: Students can easily be doing other things on their phones during class.
Warrant: Students can play games, message friends, or read content through their phones.

Claim: Violent television makes violence seem normal.
Data: People watch violent images over and over.
Warrant: Repeatedly watching something makes it seem normal.

Claim: People who are violent or lazy are like that before they watch TV. They must have those personalities that attract them to violent content.
Data: People have the choice to watch whatever they want at home.
Warrant: People can watch whatever they want on TV. There are a lot of shows that are educational or dramatic. Those shows aren't violent.

Claim: Torture can be used to get information from terrorists.
Data: Withstanding torture is very hard.
Warrant: Terrorists would give up information before they would

Claim: Torture can produce bad intelligence.
Data: Terrorists lie to make the torture stop.
Warrant: Not all information obtained during torture can be trusted.

Claim: Fast food is bad for the health of students.
Data: Fast food is often filled with low quality food ingredients.
Warrant: Low quality ingredients in food negatively effect people's health.

Claim: The supreme court should not be televised.
Data: People could watch and attempt to pressure judges or attorneys.
Warrant: Supreme Court justices would be open to more peer pressure than they already are.

Claim: Positive peer pressure can help people succeed.
Data: A slacker surrounded by hard working friends will work harder.
Warrant: Hard work can produce success.

Claim: Negative peer pressure can harm students.
Data: Peer pressure to smoke cigarettes can get someone a ticket for underage smoking.
Warrant: Tickets are a kind of harm.

Claim: Human cloning could make organs for people who need them.
Data: Scientists can already grow some human organs in lab settings.
Warrant: Making a lot of organs in labs would mean humans could transplant them more easily.

Claim: Rich people will clone themselves and live forever.
Data: Cloning involves creating a biologically identical person. It is expensive.
Warrant: Only those with a lot of money would be able to handle the cost.
